original: Låftman, Axel Folke Richard, överstelöjtnant, Växjö, f. 27/5/81 i Billingsfors, Älvsb. 1., av disp. Johan Jakob August L. o. Emma Carolina Amalia Laure’11. G. 08 m. Ingrid Mellkvist. Barn: Torkel Folkesson f. 12, DHS, disponent, Jan Folkesson 19, fotograf. — Mog:ex. i Vänersb. 01, avg:ex. fr. Gbgs hand :inst. 02. Und:-löjtn. v. Kronob. reg. 04, löjtn. 08, kapt. 17, major i armén 30, öv:löjtn. i armén 45. Andre lär. v. inf:skjutsk. 16-17, brigadkvartermäst. v. 1. inf :-brig. 21-25, befälhav. f. Växjö rull-för:omr. nr 15 32-42, exp :off. v. Kronob. inskrivn :omr. nr 11 42-46. Sekr. i styr. f. Kronob. RK-distr. 31-41. RSO, SvRKSM, Kronob. landst:förb. SM.
translated: Låftman, Axel Folke Richard, Lieutenant Colonel, Växjö, b. 27/5/81 in Billingsfors, Älvsborg County, son of dispenser Johan Jakob August L. and Emma Carolina Amalia Laure’11. Married in 1908 to Ingrid Mellkvist. Children: Torkel Folkesson b. 1912, DHS, Superintendent, Jan Folkesson b. 1919, Photographer. Completed military examination in Vänersborg in 1901, graduated from Gothenburg Handicraft Institute in 1902. Second Lieutenant in the Kronoberg Regiment in 1904, Lieutenant in 1908, Captain in 1917, Major in the Army in 1930, Lieutenant Colonel in the Army in 1945. Second instructor at the Infantry Shooting School from 1916-1917, brigade quartermaster at the 1st Infantry Brigade from 1921-1925, commander of the Växjö recruitment area no. 15 from 1932-1942, officer of the Kronoberg military district no. 11 from 1942-1946. Secretary of the board for the Kronoberg County Red Cross District from 1931-1941. Recipient of the RSO (Knight of the Order of the Sword), SvRKSM (Royal Swedish Shooting Association Medal), Kronoberg County Land Owners' Association Silver Medal.

awards.name: Knight of the Order of the Sword
Kronoberg County Land Owners' Association Silver Medal
